title: gongyunxue
author: gongyunxue
content: How about this Miner？Hashrate   113TH/s, -3%~+3%Power Consumption   3300W, -5%~+5%@Wall-PlugPower Efficiency   30J/TH, -5%~+8%@25℃Input Voltage   185-285V ACCooling   4 x12038 FANs/2*12050 FANsOperating Temperature   -5℃~35℃Noise   75dB（Max）Net Dimensions   271mm *192mm* 292mm (10.7*6*11 inch)Net Weight   12.8kgGross Dimensions   390mm *290mm *395mm (15*12*16 inch)Gross Weight   14.1kgAccessory   Power Supply (without power cord)

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: Larson311 on April 30, 2023, 07:17:21 PMQuote from: kano on April 26, 2023, 12:01:38 PMQuote from: gongyunxue on April 26, 2023, 06:05:36 AMPower Efficiency   30J/TH, -5%~+8%@25℃As per standard with Canaan all their latest miners are worse performance J/THBeen like that since the beginning ... ...I now understand why they are so cheap compared to Antminer and Whatsminerthe 113th model is not that cheap.https://shop.canaan.io/products/canaan-avalon-miner-a1246-96t?VariantsId=10001the 96th in texas is about 1050 usd.the 110th is in china so shipping and import tax turns it into over 2000https://shop.canaan.io/products/avalon-miner-a1346-110t-3300w-1?VariantsId=101331546 plus shipping and import means it is over 2200the whatsminer m50 is better.

comments.author: cecilia.sw
comments.body: I'm from Canaan Shop. Avalon Miners in Texas are on sale. A1246 are $7-$7.5/T rn. You can go check on https://shop.canaan.io/ or contact me at https://t.me/wongsiufong for inquiry.

comments.author: zanezane
comments.body: Quote from: gongyunxue on April 26, 2023, 06:05:36 AMHow about this Miner？Hashrate   113TH/s, -3%~+3%Power Consumption   3300W, -5%~+5%@Wall-PlugPower Efficiency   30J/TH, -5%~+8%@25℃Input Voltage   185-285V ACCooling   4 x12038 FANs/2*12050 FANsOperating Temperature   -5℃~35℃Noise   75dB（Max）Net Dimensions   271mm *192mm* 292mm (10.7*6*11 inch)Net Weight   12.8kgGross Dimensions   390mm *290mm *395mm (15*12*16 inch)Gross Weight   14.1kgAccessory   Power Supply (without power cord)Your miner OP,  seems to be a relatively powerful and efficient device, but its noise level may be a concern for some users. Also, the included power supply ( without a power cord ) should be compatible with the input voltage of the miner and electrical outlets in your region.

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: Quote from: zanezane on May 10, 2023, 02:55:22 PM...Your miner OP,  seems to be a relatively powerful and efficient device, but its noise level may be a concern for some users. Also, the included power supply ( without a power cord ) should be compatible with the input voltage of the miner and electrical outlets in your region.If you are implying that the miner should run on 120VAC because it is sold in the US - not going to happen because there is NO safe way to feed the miner its required 3kw without using 220VAC.
